poshmark.name: Poshmark Canada
pros: Social features (Posh Parties, sharing) boost visibility
cons: 20% commission is high for lower-priced items
Shipping cost included in buyer price can reduce competitiveness
poshmark.notes: Best for mid-range to designer fashion. Use Posh Parties to increase visibility. Cross-list to other platforms for faster sales.

ebay.name: eBay Canada

shipping.notes: Can offer free shipping or buyer-paid; GSP for international

ebay.audience: Broad international audience, collectors, bargain hunters
pros: Auction format can drive up prices for rare items
International shipping via Global Shipping Program
Best for vintage, collectible, and niche items
cons: More effort required for international shipping
ebay.authentication_note: Authenticity Guarantee for luxury items in select categories
ebay.notes: Best for unique/rare items, international buyers. Use auction format for desirable vintage pieces. Fixed price for everyday items.

etsy.name: Etsy

shipping.notes: Can purchase labels through Etsy for discounted rates

etsy.audience: Vintage enthusiasts, unique item seekers, eco-conscious buyers
pros: Dedicated vintage category (items must be 20+ years old)
Strong for jewelry and unique pieces
Good search visibility for vintage keywords
cons: Multiple fee types add up (listing + transaction + processing)
Effective commission ~10% when all fees combined
etsy.notes: Best for true vintage (20+ years). Jewelry performs exceptionally well. Use all 13 tags and detailed descriptions for SEO.

depop.name: Depop

payment_processing.notes: Plus currency conversion fees if applicable

shipping.notes: No prepaid labels in Canada; seller handles shipping

depop.audience: Gen Z (90% under 26), trend-focused, streetwear enthusiasts
pros: Good for trendy vintage and streetwear
cons: Younger demographic = lower average sale prices
No prepaid shipping labels in Canada
Payment processing fees add to costs
depop.notes: Best for trendy, youth-oriented vintage. Strong for 90s/Y2K fashion, streetwear, and branded athletic wear. Style your photos for the aesthetic.

vestiaire_collective.name: Vestiaire Collective

shipping.notes: Items ship to VC for authentication before buyer receives

vestiaire_collective.audience: Luxury fashion buyers, designer brand seekers, global market
cons: 3% payment processing on top of commission
Shipping to authentication center adds time
vestiaire_collective.authentication_note: All items authenticated by experts before shipping to buyer
vestiaire_collective.notes: Best for designer/luxury items CA$125+. Effective commission ~15% total. Better payout than TheRealReal for most price points. Set competitive prices as buyers can make offers.

therealreal.name: The RealReal

fees.commission_note: Percentages shown are what SELLER receives; TRR takes the rest

shipping.notes: Free shipping kit provided; TRR handles all logistics

therealreal.audience: High-end luxury buyers, authenticated luxury seekers
pros: Completely hands-off (they photograph, price, list, ship)
Instant payout option (60% of expected value)
cons: Lowest seller payout (20-70% depending on price)
Best only for high-value luxury items
Slow payout if item doesn't sell quickly
therealreal.authentication_note: All items authenticated by in-house experts
therealreal.notes: Best for luxury items $500+ USD when you want zero effort. Commission is steep but convenience is unmatched. Get Paid Now option provides 60% immediately.

grailed.name: Grailed

shipping.notes: Seller handles shipping; international buyers common

grailed.audience: Men's fashion enthusiasts, streetwear collectors, designer menswear buyers
grailed.notes: The go-to for men's designer and streetwear. Effective commission ~13%. Strong for brands like Supreme, Raf Simons, vintage Helmut Lang, designer denim. Price competitively as buyers negotiate.

starluv.name: Starluv

shipping.notes: Prepaid label provided, buyer pays actual cost based on weight

cons: Smaller user base than established platforms
starluv.notes: Best Canadian-owned alternative to Poshmark with significantly lower fees. Good for testing the Canadian market specifically. Growing platform worth watching.

vinted.name: Vinted
vinted.notes: Vinted exited the Canadian market in early 2024. Previously popular for zero seller fees.

thredup.name: ThredUp
thredup.notes: Consignment platform available only in the United States.

mercari.name: Mercari
mercari.notes: Available only in US and Japan markets.

meta.purpose: Resale platform characteristics, fees, and strategic guidance for Canadian sellers
